messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Digest Number 4813
messages.msgSnippet: ... I just got a little book that seems very positive and helpful: Meditations for Mothers of Toddlers by Beth Wilson Saavedra. It has a famous person quote at
messages.messageBody:
> If you have a history that could use a more particular slant, you can
> probably find it by google (if you had an alcoholic parent, or some kind of
> past
> problems or recovery needs), but to replace the voices in your head, you just
> need
> more soothing, helpful voices.
I just got a little book that seems very positive and helpful:

Meditations for Mothers of Toddlers by Beth Wilson Saavedra.

It has a famous person quote at the top, a paragraph or two about a
struggle, then an affirmation, for example: To treat my child with dignity,
I must keep my own intact.
or:
I will trust in my own abilities as I mother two very different individuals.

HTH!
--
Heather, mom to
Harriet 12.15.99
Crispin 01.25.02
heatherette@...
